acidbase 0.1.12

Parse command line argument flags

Source: R/parseArgs.R
parseArgs.Rd

Parse command line argument flags

parseArgs(
  requiredArgs = NULL,
  optionalArgs = NULL,
  flags = NULL,
  positionalArgs = FALSE
)

Arguments

requiredArgs, optionalArgs

character or NULL. Valid key-value pair argument names. For example, aaa for --aaa=AAA or --aaa AAA. Note that --aaa AAA-style arguments (note lack of =) are not currently supported.
flags

character or NULL. Valid long flag names. For example, aaa for --aaa. Short flags, such as -r, are intentionally not supported.
positionalArgs

logical(1). Require positional arguments to be defined.

Value

list. Named list containing arguments, organized by type:

  • requiredArgs

  • optionalArgs

  • flags

  • positionalArgs

Note

Updated 2020-08-09.

See also

  • argparse Python package.

  • argparser R package.

  • optparse R package.

Examples

command <- system.file("scripts", "parse-args", package = "acidbase")
args <- c(
    ## Required args:
    "--aaa=AAA", "--bbb=BBB",
    ## Optional args:
    "--ccc=CCC", "--ddd=DDD",
    ## Flags:
    "--eee", "--fff",
    ## Positional args:
    "GGG", "HHH"
)
readLines(command)
#> [1] "#!/usr/bin/env Rscript"                          
#> [2] ""                                                
#> [3] "acidbase::parseArgs("                            
#> [4] "    requiredArgs = c(\"aaa\", \"bbb\"),"         
#> [5] "    optionalArgs = c(\"ccc\", \"ddd\", \"zzz\"),"
#> [6] "    flags = c(\"eee\", \"fff\"),"                
#> [7] "    positionalArgs = TRUE"                       
#> [8] ")"                                               
out <- shell(command = command, args = args, stdout = TRUE)
print(out)
#>  [1] "$requiredArgs"                "        aaa         bbb "    
#>  [3] "\"--aaa=AAA\" \"--bbb=BBB\" " ""                            
#>  [5] "$optionalArgs"                "        ccc         ddd "    
#>  [7] "\"--ccc=CCC\" \"--ddd=DDD\" " ""                            
#>  [9] "$flags"                       "    eee     fff "            
#> [11] "\"--eee\" \"--fff\" "         ""                            
#> [13] "$positionalArgs"              "[1] \"GGG\" \"HHH\""         
#> [15] ""
